viii ABSTRACT RAMOS, Yago Domingues . Synthesis and c haracterization of magnetic materials with Iron and Vulcan XC obtained by solution combustion method and the potential use in methylene blue adsorption and degradation processes . Thesis (M .Sc. Chemistry) - Instituto de Qu√≠mica, Universidade Federal do Rio de Janeiro , Rio de Janeiro, 202 1.

Iron oxides and composites were synthesized using a solution combustion method, using ferric nitrate as an oxidizer and starch as a fuel in an aqueous medium; in which the composites had carbon black Vulcan XC-72R added . Synthesis parameters like fuel and oxidant molar ratio, atmosphere with presence and absence of O 2 and temperat ures were described and well considered . The materials were characterized by X-Ray D iffraction, Infrared and Raman s pectroscopies; and, therefore, hypotheses were proposed in view of the particular natures assessed. The synthesis in a reducing environment at 300 ¬∫C promoted a composite with a magnetite phase in a major way coupling Fe 3O4 magnetic nanoparticles in a CB -rGO matrix; and t heir adsorptive and catalytic capacities were evaluated ag ainst the methylene blue (MB) dye . An optimized model was developed in order to measure the limits of the material and system, where the AM degradation tests we re accompanied by Ultraviolet -Visible (UV-Vis) spectroscopy . The advanced oxidative process ( AOP) from this composite material, in the presence of H 2O2, resulted in the removal of 97, 4% of the initial concentration of MB in 25 min, with an outstanding m aximum Methylene Blue Index (MBI ) of 1947 mg .g- 1; higher than studies described in the literature under comparable circumstances. In a complementary way, the behavior observed in the degradation of the dye was evaluated by analyzing the supernatant solution and composite after the proces s, aiming to add a first step in understanding the essence of the interactions.
Keywords: Solution Combustion Synthesis, Iron Oxides, Composites, Carbon Black, Graphene Oxides, Methylene Blue, Adsorption, Advanced Oxidation Process.
